title: Lane 3000 - Change from IP to USB connection
text: Use the merchant card press 6 and 1 and 2 - green button, use the arrow to get to "via ECR" confirm Use the merchant card press 6 and 1 and 3 - green button, use the arrow to get to Com type "USB slave".
description:
Use the merchant card

press 6 and 1 and 2 - green button, use the arrow to get to "via ECR" confirm 

Use the merchant card

press 6 and 1 and 3 - green button, use the arrow  to get to Com type "USB slave".

title: Card terminal is not responding
text: If you are uncertain about which com-port the card terminal is connected to, use the below method: Copy ZVT-COMM (Program) to the customer's pc (desktop). Close the POS program and test all com ports through ZVT-COMM In RIAB it's always COM1 or COM4.
description:
If you are uncertain about which com-port the card terminal is connected to, use the below method:


Copy ZVT-COMM (Program) to the customer's pc (desktop).


Close the POS program and test all com ports through ZVT-COMM


In RIAB it's always COM1 or COM4.

title: "Configure Terminal" can not be opened
text: If nothing happens when clicking in the POS on Shortcuts->Configure Terminal, you have to change the parameter TerminalType from 1 to 10 (via DdD Admin-> Adv. configuration)
description: If nothing happens when clicking in the POS on Shortcuts->Configure Terminal, you have to change the parameter TerminalType from 1 to 10 (via DdD Admin-> Adv. configuration)

title: Card terminal - Technical error - needs to download card agreements
text: Some times, the card terminal will need to downloads card agreements in order to do transactions. Usually this can be done via DDD POS, however sometimes you will get a "technical error". If this happens, you need to empty the print buffer on the cardterminal manually, since DDD POS cannot properly communicate with the cardterminal at this stage. Swipe the merchant card on the terminal, press 9 for system menu, then press one for empty print buffer, you will need to confirm this with the green button. When this is done, reboot the card terminal, then restart DDD POS. You will now be able to download card agreements via DDD POS. Last step is to run a reconciliation, when this is done, the card terminal is ready for use once again.
description:
Some times, the card terminal will need to downloads card agreements in order to do transactions. Usually this can be done via DDD POS, however sometimes you will get a "technical error".


 


If this happens, you need to empty the print buffer on the cardterminal manually, since DDD POS cannot properly communicate with the cardterminal at this stage. 


Swipe the merchant card on the terminal, press 9 for system menu, then press one for empty print buffer, you will need to confirm this with the green button. 


When this is done, reboot the card terminal, then restart DDD POS. 


You will now be able to download card agreements via DDD POS.


Last step is to run a reconciliation, when this is done, the card terminal is ready for use once again.

title: Installation of the Ingenico IPP 350
text: Connect the IPP350 via USB to the computer Install software from https://ingenico.com/en/resources/ingenico-usb-driver-application-and-installation-guide Follow the installation put port 20 on USB Driver parameters: finish installation POS-PC In the control panel - device manager change the port setup for the Ingenico terminal to 20. Remenber to change the Terminal type to 10 and anable UseTerminal to 1.
description:
Connect the IPP350 via USB to the computer

Install software from 

https://ingenico.com/en/resources/ingenico-usb-driver-application-and-installation-guide

Follow the installation put port 20 on USB Driver parameters:


finish installation

POS-PC

In the control panel - device manager change the port setup for the Ingenico terminal to 20.


Remenber to change the Terminal type to 10 and anable UseTerminal to 1.
